trans-unit.source: Setup your subscription with Lookout MTP | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Setup your subscription with Lookout MTP | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: This topics provides details on how to configure Lookout MTP.
trans-unit.target: This topics provides details on how to configure Lookout MTP.

trans-unit.source: Set up your subscription for Lookout mobile threat protection
trans-unit.target: Set up your subscription for Lookout mobile threat protection

trans-unit.source: To get your subscription ready for the Lookout MTP service, Lookout support (enterprisesupport@lookout.com) will need the following information about your Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).
trans-unit.target: To get your subscription ready for the Lookout MTP service, Lookout support (enterprisesupport@lookout.com) will need the following information about your Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Tenant ID
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Tenant ID

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Group Object ID for full Lookout MTP console access
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Group Object ID for full Lookout MTP console access

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Group Object ID for restricted Lookout MTP console access (optional)
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Group Object ID for restricted Lookout MTP console access (optional)

trans-unit.source: Use the information in the following section to gather the information you need to give to the Lookout support team.
trans-unit.target: Use the information in the following section to gather the information you need to give to the Lookout support team.

trans-unit.source: Getting your Azure AD information
trans-unit.target: Getting your Azure AD information

trans-unit.source: Getting you Azure AD tenant ID
trans-unit.target: Getting you Azure AD tenant ID

trans-unit.source: Log into the Azure AD management portal: https://manage.windowsazure.com and select your subscription.
trans-unit.target: Log into the Azure AD management portal: https://manage.windowsazure.com and select your subscription.

trans-unit.source: screenshot of the Azure AD page showing the name of the tenant](../media/mtp/aad_tenant_name.png) When you choose the name of your subscription, the resulting URL includes the subscription ID.
trans-unit.target: screenshot of the Azure AD page showing the name of the tenant](../media/mtp/aad_tenant_name.png) When you choose the name of your subscription, the resulting URL includes the subscription ID.

trans-unit.source: If you have any issues finding your subscription ID, the [Microsoft support article](https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Find-your-Office-365-tenant-ID-6891b561-a52d-4ade-9f39-b492285e2c9b?ui=en-US&rs=en-US&ad=US) provides additional tips.
trans-unit.target: If you have any issues finding your subscription ID, the [Microsoft support article](https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Find-your-Office-365-tenant-ID-6891b561-a52d-4ade-9f39-b492285e2c9b?ui=en-US&rs=en-US&ad=US) provides additional tips.

trans-unit.source: Getting your Azure AD Group ID
trans-unit.target: Getting your Azure AD Group ID

trans-unit.source: The Lookout MTP console supports 2 levels of access:
trans-unit.target: The Lookout MTP console supports 2 levels of access:

trans-unit.source: **Full Access:** Azure AD admin can create a group for users that will have Full Access and optionally they may create a group for users that will have Restricted Access.
trans-unit.target: **Full Access:** Azure AD admin can create a group for users that will have Full Access and optionally they may create a group for users that will have Restricted Access.

trans-unit.source: Only users in these groups will be able to login to the **Lookout MTP Console**.
trans-unit.target: Only users in these groups will be able to login to the **Lookout MTP Console**.

trans-unit.source: **Restricted Access:** No access to several configuration and enrollment related modules of the Lookout MTP console; read-only access to the **Security Policy** module of the Lookout MTP console.
trans-unit.target: **Restricted Access:** No access to several configuration and enrollment related modules of the Lookout MTP console; read-only access to the **Security Policy** module of the Lookout MTP console.

trans-unit.source: For more details on the permissions, read [this article](https://personal.support.lookout.com/hc/en-us/articles/114094105653) on the Lookout website.
trans-unit.target: For more details on the permissions, read [this article](https://personal.support.lookout.com/hc/en-us/articles/114094105653) on the Lookout website.

trans-unit.source: The **Group Object ID** can be found on the properties page of the group in the Azure AD management console.
trans-unit.target: The **Group Object ID** can be found on the properties page of the group in the Azure AD management console.

trans-unit.source: screenshot of the properties page with GroupID field highlighted
trans-unit.target: screenshot of the properties page with GroupID field highlighted

trans-unit.source: Once you have gathered this information, contact Lookout support (email: enterprisesupport@lookout.com).
trans-unit.target: Once you have gathered this information, contact Lookout support (email: enterprisesupport@lookout.com).

trans-unit.source: Lookout support will work with your primary contact to onboard your subscription and create your Lookout MTP Enterprise account, using the information that you collected.
trans-unit.target: Lookout support will work with your primary contact to onboard your subscription and create your Lookout MTP Enterprise account, using the information that you collected.

trans-unit.source: Configure your subscription with Lookout MTP
trans-unit.target: Configure your subscription with Lookout MTP

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Setup your MTP
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Setup your MTP

trans-unit.source: After Lookout support creates your Lookout MTP Enterprise account, you can login to the Lookout MTP Console.
trans-unit.target: After Lookout support creates your Lookout MTP Enterprise account, you can login to the Lookout MTP Console.

trans-unit.source: An email from Lookout is sent to the primary contact for your company with a link to the login url:https://aad.lookout.com/les?action=consent
trans-unit.target: An email from Lookout is sent to the primary contact for your company with a link to the login url:https://aad.lookout.com/les?action=consent

trans-unit.source: You must use a user account with the Azure AD role of Global Admin when you first log in to the Lookout MTP console, since the Lookout MTP requires this to register your Azure AD tenant.
trans-unit.target: You must use a user account with the Azure AD role of Global Admin when you first log in to the Lookout MTP console, since the Lookout MTP requires this to register your Azure AD tenant.

trans-unit.source: Subsequent logins will not require the user to have this level of Azure AD privilege.
trans-unit.target: Subsequent logins will not require the user to have this level of Azure AD privilege.

trans-unit.source: In this first login, a consent page will be displayed.
trans-unit.target: In this first login, a consent page will be displayed.

trans-unit.source: Choose **accept** to complete the registration.
trans-unit.target: Choose **accept** to complete the registration.

trans-unit.source: screenshot of the first time login page of the Lookout MTP console](../media/mtp/lookout_mtp_initial_login.png) Once you have accepted and consented, you are redirected to the Lookout MTP Console.
trans-unit.target: screenshot of the first time login page of the Lookout MTP console](../media/mtp/lookout_mtp_initial_login.png) Once you have accepted and consented, you are redirected to the Lookout MTP Console.

trans-unit.source: Subsequent logins after the initial registration, can be done using the URL: https://aad.lookout.com
trans-unit.target: Subsequent logins after the initial registration, can be done using the URL: https://aad.lookout.com

trans-unit.source: See the [troubleshooting article](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/intune/troubleshoot/troubleshooting-lookout-integration) if you run into login issues.
trans-unit.target: See the [troubleshooting article](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/intune/troubleshoot/troubleshooting-lookout-integration) if you run into login issues.

trans-unit.source: The next steps outline the tasks that must be done to complete the Lookout MTP set up within the [Lookout MTP Console](https://aad.lookout.com).
trans-unit.target: The next steps outline the tasks that must be done to complete the Lookout MTP set up within the [Lookout MTP Console](https://aad.lookout.com).

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Configure the Intune connector
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Configure the Intune connector

trans-unit.source: In the Lookout MTP console, go to the **System** module, choose the **Connectors** tab, and select **Intune**.
trans-unit.target: In the Lookout MTP console, go to the **System** module, choose the **Connectors** tab, and select **Intune**.

trans-unit.source: screenshot of the Lookout MTP console with the connectors tab open, and Intune option highlighted
trans-unit.target: screenshot of the Lookout MTP console with the connectors tab open, and Intune option highlighted

trans-unit.source: In the connection settings option, configure the heartbeat frequency in minutes.
trans-unit.target: In the connection settings option, configure the heartbeat frequency in minutes.

trans-unit.source: With completion of this step, your Intune connector is now ready.
trans-unit.target: With completion of this step, your Intune connector is now ready.

trans-unit.source: screenshot of the connection settings tab with showing heartbeat frequency configured
trans-unit.target: screenshot of the connection settings tab with showing heartbeat frequency configured

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Configure enrollment groups
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Configure enrollment groups

trans-unit.source: On the **Enrollment Management** option, define a set of users whose devices should be enrolled with Lookout.
trans-unit.target: On the **Enrollment Management** option, define a set of users whose devices should be enrolled with Lookout.

trans-unit.source: Best practice is to start with a small group of users to test and become familiar with how the integration works.
trans-unit.target: Best practice is to start with a small group of users to test and become familiar with how the integration works.

trans-unit.source: Once you are satisfied with your test results, you may extend the enrollment to additional groups of users.
trans-unit.target: Once you are satisfied with your test results, you may extend the enrollment to additional groups of users.

trans-unit.source: To get started with enrollments groups, first define an Azure AD security group that would be a good first set of users to enroll in Lookout MTP.
trans-unit.target: To get started with enrollments groups, first define an Azure AD security group that would be a good first set of users to enroll in Lookout MTP.

trans-unit.source: Once you have the group created in Azure, AD, in the Lookout MTP Console, go to the **Enrollement Management** option and add the Azure AD security group **Display Name(s)** for enrollment.
trans-unit.target: Once you have the group created in Azure, AD, in the Lookout MTP Console, go to the **Enrollement Management** option and add the Azure AD security group **Display Name(s)** for enrollment.

trans-unit.source: When a user is in an enrollment group, any of their devices that are identified and supported in Azure AD is enrolled and is eligible for activation in Lookout MTP.
trans-unit.target: When a user is in an enrollment group, any of their devices that are identified and supported in Azure AD is enrolled and is eligible for activation in Lookout MTP.

trans-unit.source: The first time they open the Lookout for Work app on their supported device, it is activated in Lookout MTP.
trans-unit.target: The first time they open the Lookout for Work app on their supported device, it is activated in Lookout MTP.

trans-unit.source: screenshot of the Intune connector enrollment page
trans-unit.target: screenshot of the Intune connector enrollment page

trans-unit.source: Best practice is to leave the increment to check for new devices to be the default 5 minutes.
trans-unit.target: Best practice is to leave the increment to check for new devices to be the default 5 minutes.

trans-unit.source: The display name is case sensitive.
trans-unit.target: The display name is case sensitive.

trans-unit.source: Use the **Display Name** as shown the in the **Properties** page of the security group in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Use the **Display Name** as shown the in the **Properties** page of the security group in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Note in the picture below that the **Properties** page of the security group, the Display Name is camel case.
trans-unit.target: Note in the picture below that the **Properties** page of the security group, the Display Name is camel case.

trans-unit.source: The title however is displayed in all lower case and should not be used to enter into the Lookout MTP console.
trans-unit.target: The title however is displayed in all lower case and should not be used to enter into the Lookout MTP console.

trans-unit.source: screenshot of the Azure portal, Azure Active Directory service, properties page
trans-unit.target: screenshot of the Azure portal, Azure Active Directory service, properties page

trans-unit.source: The current release has the following limitations:
trans-unit.target: The current release has the following limitations:

trans-unit.source: There is no validation for the group diplay names.
trans-unit.target: There is no validation for the group diplay names.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to use the value in the **DISPLAY NAME** field shown in Azure portal for the Azure AD security group.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to use the value in the **DISPLAY NAME** field shown in Azure portal for the Azure AD security group.

trans-unit.source: Creating groups within groups is not currently supported.
trans-unit.target: Creating groups within groups is not currently supported.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD security groups specified should only contain users and not nested groups.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD security groups specified should only contain users and not nested groups.

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Configure state sync
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Configure state sync

trans-unit.source: In the **State Sync** option, specify the type of data should be sent to Intune.
trans-unit.target: In the **State Sync** option, specify the type of data should be sent to Intune.

trans-unit.source: Currently, you must enable both device status and threat status in order for the Lookout Intune integration to work correctly.
trans-unit.target: Currently, you must enable both device status and threat status in order for the Lookout Intune integration to work correctly.

trans-unit.source: These are enabled by default.
trans-unit.target: These are enabled by default.

trans-unit.source: Step 5: Configure error report email recipient information
trans-unit.target: Step 5: Configure error report email recipient information

trans-unit.source: In the **Error Management** option, enter the email address that should receive the error reports.
trans-unit.target: In the **Error Management** option, enter the email address that should receive the error reports.

trans-unit.source: screenshot of the Intune connector error management page
trans-unit.target: screenshot of the Intune connector error management page

trans-unit.source: Step 6: Configure email notifications
trans-unit.target: Step 6: Configure email notifications

trans-unit.source: If you would like to receive email alerts for threats, sign in to the [Lookout MTP console](https://aad.lookout.com)with the user account that should receive the notifications.
trans-unit.target: If you would like to receive email alerts for threats, sign in to the [Lookout MTP console](https://aad.lookout.com)with the user account that should receive the notifications.

trans-unit.source: Go to the **System** module, and on the **Preferences** tab, choose the desired notifications and set them to **ON**.
trans-unit.target: Go to the **System** module, and on the **Preferences** tab, choose the desired notifications and set them to **ON**.

trans-unit.source: Save your changes.
trans-unit.target: Save your changes.

trans-unit.source: screenshot of the preferences page with the user account displayed](../media/mtp/lookout-mtp-email-notifications.png) If you no longer wish to receive email notifications, set the notifications to **OFF** and save your changes.
trans-unit.target: screenshot of the preferences page with the user account displayed](../media/mtp/lookout-mtp-email-notifications.png) If you no longer wish to receive email notifications, set the notifications to **OFF** and save your changes.

trans-unit.source: Step 7: Configure threat classification
trans-unit.target: Step 7: Configure threat classification

trans-unit.source: Lookout MTP classifies mobile threats of various types.
trans-unit.target: Lookout MTP classifies mobile threats of various types.

trans-unit.source: The [Lookout MTP threat classifications](http://personal.support.lookout.com/hc/en-us/articles/114094130693) have default risk levels associated with them.
trans-unit.target: The [Lookout MTP threat classifications](http://personal.support.lookout.com/hc/en-us/articles/114094130693) have default risk levels associated with them.

trans-unit.source: These can be changed at any time to suite your company requirements.
trans-unit.target: These can be changed at any time to suite your company requirements.

trans-unit.source: screenshot of the policy page showing threat and classifications
trans-unit.target: screenshot of the policy page showing threat and classifications

trans-unit.source: The risk levels specified here is an important aspect of MTP because the Intune integration calculates device compliance according to these risk levels at runtime.
trans-unit.target: The risk levels specified here is an important aspect of MTP because the Intune integration calculates device compliance according to these risk levels at runtime.

trans-unit.source: In other words, Intune Admin sets a rule in policy to determine a device is non-compliant if it has an active threat with a minimum level of: high, medium, or low.
trans-unit.target: In other words, Intune Admin sets a rule in policy to determine a device is non-compliant if it has an active threat with a minimum level of: high, medium, or low.

trans-unit.source: The threat classification policy in MTP directly drives the device compliance calculation in Intune.
trans-unit.target: The threat classification policy in MTP directly drives the device compliance calculation in Intune.

trans-unit.source: Watching enrollment
trans-unit.target: Watching enrollment

trans-unit.source: Once the setup is complete, Lookout MTP starts to poll Azure AD for devices that correspond to the specified enrollment groups.
trans-unit.target: Once the setup is complete, Lookout MTP starts to poll Azure AD for devices that correspond to the specified enrollment groups.

trans-unit.source: Information about the devices enrolled can be found on the Devices module.
trans-unit.target: Information about the devices enrolled can be found on the Devices module.

trans-unit.source: The initial status for devices is shown as pending.
trans-unit.target: The initial status for devices is shown as pending.

trans-unit.source: The device status will change once the Lookout for work app is installed, opened, and activated on the device.
trans-unit.target: The device status will change once the Lookout for work app is installed, opened, and activated on the device.

trans-unit.source: Details on how to get the Lookout for work app pushed to the device can be found in [configure and deploy Lookout for work apps](configure-and-deploy-lookout-for-work-apps.md) topic.
trans-unit.target: Details on how to get the Lookout for work app pushed to the device can be found in [configure and deploy Lookout for work apps](configure-and-deploy-lookout-for-work-apps.md) topic.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Enable Lookout MTP connection Intune
trans-unit.target: Enable Lookout MTP connection Intune
